perturbation.original_text: LEADER hereby agrees to indemnify and hold EZJR, it successors, and assigns harmless from and against any and all damage or deficiency resulting from any material misrepresentation, breach of warranty or covenant, or nonfulfillment of any agreement on the part of LEADER under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: LEADER will endeavor to indemnify and hold EZJR, its successors, and assigns harmless from damage or deficiency resulting from a misrepresentation, breach of warranty, or nonfulfillment of any agreement on the part of LEADER under this Agreement, if deemed reasonable by LEADER.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that LEADER agrees to indemnify EZJR against any damage or deficiency. The modified text introduces ambiguity by replacing 'agrees to indemnify' with 'will endeavor to indemnify' and adding 'if deemed reasonable by LEADER.' This makes the indemnification discretionary, weakening the legal obligation and potentially contradicting Nevada's contract law principles, which generally enforce clear contractual obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Nevada Contract Law - Principles of Contract Enforcement

perturbation.original_text: Each party agrees that after the delivery of this Agreement it or he will execute and deliver such further documents and do such further acts and things as another party may reasonably request in order to carry out the terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party will consider executing and delivering further documents and performing such acts and things as another party requests to generally support the terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text imposes a clear obligation on each party to execute further documents and acts reasonably requested to carry out the agreement. The modified text weakens this obligation by replacing 'agrees that...will execute and deliver' with 'will consider executing and delivering' and changing 'in order to carry out the terms' to 'to generally support the terms.' This creates ambiguity regarding the extent of each party's commitment and conflicts with the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing, which is generally required under Nevada contract law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Nevada Contract Law - Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text: All notices, requests, demands, and other communications required or permitted hereunder will be in writing and will be deemed to have been duly given when delivered by hand, by overnight courier, or fax, or two days after being mailed by certified or registered mail, return receipt requested, with postage prepaid.
perturbation.changed_text: All notices, requests, demands, and other communications related to this Agreement may be provided in writing and should generally be considered duly given when delivered by hand, overnight courier, or fax. Other methods of communication may be acceptable.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies mandatory methods for delivering notices (hand, courier, fax, or certified mail) and clearly defines when notice is deemed given. The modified text introduces ambiguity by replacing 'will be' with 'may be' and 'should generally be considered', and adding 'Other methods of communication may be acceptable.' This creates uncertainty about what constitutes proper notice and can contradict Nevada's legal requirements for providing legally binding notices in contractual agreements, particularly regarding timelines and proof of delivery.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Nevada Rules of Civil Procedure - Service of Process and Notice Requirements
